intro: Melampyrum angustissimum, commonly known as narrowleaf touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and alternate, often with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
